result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zivon Alonzo Claybourne

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zivon Alonzo Claybourne in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Zivon Alonzo Claybourne.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Attorney Sargent moved to withdraw as counsel upon request from the defendant.  Motion to withdraw by defense counsel granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zivon Alonzo Claybourne in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defendant has not retained private counsel.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Zivon Alonzo Claybourne in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Parties do not have an agreement.  Defendant intends to retain private counsel.  Court set a status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zivon Alonzo Claybourne in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:11 AM. Case in Court for a Calendar Call. Court withdraws stayed warrant. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Court set matter as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Calendar call scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (11 pages) commencing 03-30-2022, by KATHERINE M. NELSON.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Zivon Alonzo Claybourne in court by video with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent who appears in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Daering.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zivon Alonzo Claybourne in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is held under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zivon Alonzo Claybourne in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Sargent is in trial in another court on another matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license and state required insurance.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Zivon Alonzo Claybourne in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on January 21, 2022 at 2:00 PM.
